pullRequest.title: [Enhancement] Validation for Unreferenced Feedback of Programming Exercises
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes

Motivation and Context


We want to visualise that the unreferenced feedback should have a score and a detailed text. This is needed specially for programming exercises.
Description


Added required to <input> and <textarea> DOM elements
Changed the check when it is allowed to save/submit a assessment for programming exercises

Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
Navigate to Course Administration
Assess a programming exercise
3.1 Add a referenced (inline) feedback -> You should be able to submit/save (see if buttons are disabled). Delete this feedback afterwards
3.2 Add unreferenced feedback -> You should not be able to submit/save unless you entered a detail text and score. Delete this feedback afterwards
3.3 Add general feedback -> You should be able to submit/save.
3.4 Add a referenced (inline) feedback -> You should be able to submit/save.
3.5 Add unreferenced feedback -> You should not be able to submit/save unless you entered a detail text and score.
3.6 Add more unreferenced feedback -> You should not be able to submit/save unless you entered a detail text and score.

Test Coverage

Nothing changed.
Screenshots


Unreferenced feedback

commit.message: highlight that for unreferenced feedback score and text should be set
do not allow to submit/save unrefereced feedback for programming exercises
change logic and rename isValid method and add additional check for programming exercises
remove redundant check as it is checked in isEmpty

nodes.bodyText: Since this only evaluates to true if the lengths match, this can simplify to return that.length > 0 && that.filter(Feedback.isValid).length === that.length; which saves a tiny bit of performance by not filtering twice.
